fs.fibu2.filter
Class ValueFilter

java.lang.Object
  fs.fibu2.filter.ValueFilter
All Implemented Interfaces:
EntryFilter
public class ValueFilter
extends java.lang.Object
implements EntryFilter

This filter filters entries according to their value field.

Author:
Simon Hampe

          Creates a value filter using range filtering between 0 and 0

ValueFilter

public ValueFilter(StandardFilterComponent.Selection typeOfFilter,
                   float equalityFilter,
                   java.lang.Float minFilter,
                   java.lang.Float maxFilter,
                   java.lang.String regexFilter)
Creates a ValueFilter.

Parameters:
typeOfFilter - Whether entries with a certain value are desired (EQUALITY), a certain range (RANGE) or entries whose value matches a certain regular expression (REGEX). Depending on this value, only a subset of the other parameters is really needed. The default value is RANGE
equalityFilter - The filter value for equality filtering
minFilter - The minimum value for range filtering. The default is 0
maxFilter - The maximum value for range filtering. The default is 0
regexFilter - The string used for regular expression filtering
Throws:
java.util.regex.PatternSyntaxException - - If regex is not a valid regular expression and REGEX is selected

getDescription

public java.lang.String getDescription()
Specified by:
getDescription in interface EntryFilter
Returns:
An exact description of this filter, e.g. 'Date range filter between 1.1.2009 and 23.4.2010'

getEditor

public EntryFilterEditor getEditor(Journal j)
Specified by:
getEditor in interface EntryFilter
Parameters:
j - The editor might need data about the journal in which it filters (e.g. a list of available categories).
Returns:
An editor for the filter. If the filter should not be editable, this should return null. The editor component should already be filled with the data of the current configuration.

verifyEntry

Specified by:
verifyEntry in interface EntryFilter
Returns:
Whether e fulfills the criteria of this filter. The null entry should verify no criterion at all.

createMeFromPreferences

public EntryFilter createMeFromPreferences(java.util.prefs.Preferences filterNode)
                                    throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
Description copied from interface: EntryFilter
Creates a new filter from the given Preferences object, which (supposedly) has been created by calling the method EntryFilterEntryFilter.insertMyPreferences(Preferences) before.

Specified by:
createMeFromPreferences in interface EntryFilter
Parameters:
filterNode - This should be the node of name filter which was inserted by the EntryFilterEntryFilter.insertMyPreferences(Preferences) method.
Returns:
An entry filter conforming to the given preferences.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - - If the given node is null or does not contain a valid configuration

insertMyPreferences

public void insertMyPreferences(java.util.prefs.Preferences node)
                         throws java.lang.NullPointerException
Description copied from interface: EntryFilter
Inserts this filter's configuration into the given node. The format should always be as follows:
- A node with name 'filter' should be inserted in node. All further nodes are inserted within this node
- In its map, this node should have an entry with key 'id' and value as returned by EntryFilterEntryFilter.getID(). This is necessary to be able to create filters from their preference nodes

Specified by:
insertMyPreferences in interface EntryFilter
Parameters:
node - The node under which this filter's configuration should be inserted
Throws:
java.lang.NullPointerException - - If node == null
